Replace.Text: Georgia

Georgia, congratulations, you are finally in the limelight. Although people don't know much about you, you'll soon be able to show people what makes you different – the huge caliber cannon is really powerful. Go ahead, crush the enemy's defenses with artillery fire, and you will make people realize the prestige of the Iowa class battleships again.
No matter how strong the armor is, it can only be shattered by the giant cannon!
As the leader of the Eagle Union, Georgia's powerful naval guns, international trade routes, and prestigious plantations made Georgia invincible.

Georgia, as the Iowa class battleship prototype solution IV, has a powerful firepower, which gives her a unique advantage in attacking cities and navies——— all units in Georgia have [ICON_Strength] Combat Strength bonuses when attacking area defense and navy, while long-range units and navies can also deal full damage to cities. Therefore, Georgia's naval strength is not bad, not to mention the blessing of strong unique units. Georgia needs to explore the surrounding area as soon as possible in the early stages of the game in order to accelerate its development with strong international trade routes and plantations, and then develop industrial zones to consolidate the advantages accumulated in the early stage. All this makes Georgia suitable for victory in conquest and victory in culture, and her strength in both areas cannot be underestimated.

The Iowa class battleship prototype IV was only one of a series of proposals proposed during the demonstration of the Iowa class battleships in May 1938. Therefore, in history, the battleship Georgia was just an idea in people's minds (this idea is not necessarily called Georgia), and there was no corresponding ship built into service. The only places where she appears are World of Warships and Azur Lane.

In World of Warships, the ship appeared in early game promotional images, but remained hidden. The model was relaunched on February 21, 2019, on the occasion of the 110th anniversary of the Great White Fleet's circumnavigation of the world. The difference is that the developers replaced her with three twin 457mm MKA turrets. It makes up for the regret that there is only MK6, and the overall weight can be basically unchanged. However, in the process of designing the Iowa class, the US Navy never considered the twin 457mm scheme, only the triple solution, which was an important reason why the design was overweight. The state of Georgia's hull in World of Warships is 1945. In "Azur Lane", Georgia appeared as the plan ship of the second phase of the linkage between "Azur Lane" and "World of Warships".

Georgia is named after Georgia states, one of the 7 southeastern states of the United States. Historically, a Virginia-class battleship was named Georgia, and she was a member of the famous Great White Fleet.
Heritage of Great White Fleet
Develop the navy as much as possible to explore the world. Love the civilizations that love to explore the world, and hate the civilizations that ignore exploring the world.
(You actively explore the world)
Georgia loves the civilizations that actively explore the world
(You neglect to explore the world)
Georgia hates ignoring civilizations that explore the world
Heavy Barrel Blaster

Begin the game with the Irrigation technologies unlocked and Plantation +3 [ICON_Culture] Culture, +1 [ICON_TradeRoute] Trade Route capacity and unleash Culture Bomb on surrounding territory. Each Specialty District in the Destination city of the [ICON_TradeRoute] Trade Route offers +2 [ICON_Culture] Culture, or +4 [ICON_Culture] Culture in the case of an International [ICON_TradeRoute] Trade Route. +7 [ICON_Strength] Combat Strength for all units when attacking naval units and district defenses. Gain the Iowa-class battleship prototype scheme IV unique unit when the Advanced Ballistics technology is researched.

Begin the game with the Irrigation technologies unlocked and Plantation +3 [ICON_Culture] Culture, +1 [ICON_TradeRoute] Trade Route capacity and unleash Culture Bomb on surrounding territory. Each Specialty District in the Destination city of the [ICON_TradeRoute] Trade Route offers +2 [ICON_Culture] Culture, or +4 [ICON_Culture] Culture in the case of an International [ICON_TradeRoute] Trade Route. +7 [ICON_Strength] Combat Strength for all units when attacking naval units and district defenses, and all naval units and ranged units can do full damage against cities. Gain the Iowa-class battleship prototype scheme IV unique unit when the Advanced Ballistics technology is researched.
Iowa-class battleship prototype scheme IV
Georgia's unique Atomic era naval unit that replaces the Missile Cruiser, unlocked earlier. Expensive to build, but with a powerful range and strong long-range combat effectiveness.

This was one of a series of proposals proposed during the demonstration of the Iowa class battleships in May 1938, and was then listed as Option IV. The scheme was based on the South Dakota-class battleships, elongated the hull, switched to double chimneys. At the same time, the South Dakota-class thruster design was followed, so that the design speed could reach 33 knots. Three triple 406mm/45 MK6 turrets were planned, which were slightly shorter and lighter in tonnage than other 50-caliber 406mm guns of the same period, but lacked firepower. In fact, if the Iowa class ends up with the MK6 turret design, it will have no effect other than increasing the speed by 6 knots.
Heavy Barrel Blaster
+{1_Amount}, attack district defenses or naval units
+7 [ICON_Strength] Combat Strength when attacking district defenses or naval units

Row.Text: I have this in mind and am happy to accept your friendship.
As much as I would love to accept this friendship, my people still need to consider.
I want to announce our friendship to the world, will you?
Well, our friendship will be as profound as the blue sea and blue sky.
Looks like you're not ready. It's okay, I'll come back when you're ready.
Yes, you are courageous. But your army will be shattered by artillery fire, and the roar of this cannon is your last memory!
It's a pity, but I think there is no point in maintaining a semblance of peace now. So, meet the fate of being shattered by the giant cannon!
Your envoys have arrived safely, and they will be warmly received by us.
No, we haven't reached that kind of relationship yet.
Soda, fruit... My envoys bring much more than that—they carry my warmth and kindness, will you receive them?
I knew you would. However, I appreciate your courage in doing so.
I am trying to be as friendly as possible with you. It is clear that all this is useless work. (Condemn you)

I am the battleship to which the Eagle Union belongs, Georgia. Compared to those distant sisters, my main gun is a little bigger. And I, with this main cannon, will smash all the enemies in front of me. So, will you be my enemy, friend?
Want to taste fruit in a city near us? Georgia's "Peach State" is not a waste.
I would be happy to visit your city.
Let's exchange information about the location of the capital. Be honest, it's good for you and me.
I have a dream that one day the world will be peaceful again. I think with people like you, this day is not far away.
If you are ambitious and have no action, you can't do anything?
The sea is vast and charming, and ocean-going fleets are sailing around the world in search of rare beauty. I think we can form an alliance.
At the borders of the Eagle Union, your troops are gathering, I think there is no need to be so hypocritical between us.
I have a dream that one day, there will be no more gunsmoke on the sea, and everyone will return to peace... But now I don't see that day anymore...
This deal is good for you and me.
It is clear that I cannot agree.
